Functions.Name: LoginPrep
Functions.Docs:
LoginPrep returns a login token, and also sets it as cookie. Both must be
present in the call to Login.

Functions.Name: Login
Functions.Docs:
Login returns a session token for the credentials, or fails with error code
"user:badLogin". Call LoginPrep to get a loginToken.

Functions.Name: Logout
Functions.Docs: Logout invalidates the session token.

Functions.Name: Version
Functions.Docs: Version returns the version, goos and goarch.

Functions.Name: Token
Functions.Docs:
Token returns a single-use token to use for an SSE connection. A token can only
be used for a single SSE connection. Tokens are stored in memory for a maximum
of 1 minute, with at most 10 unused tokens (the most recently created) per
account.

Functions.Name: Request
Functions.Docs:
Requests sends a new request for an open SSE connection. Any currently active
request for the connection will be canceled, but this is done asynchrously, so
the SSE connection may still send results for the previous request. Callers
should take care to ignore such results. If req.Cancel is set, no new request is
started.

Functions.Name: ParsedMessage
Functions.Docs:
ParsedMessage returns enough to render the textual body of a message. It is
assumed the client already has other fields through MessageItem.

Functions.Name: FromAddressSettingsSave
Functions.Docs: FromAddressSettingsSave saves per-"From"-address settings.

Functions.Name: MessageFindMessageID
Functions.Docs:
MessageFindMessageID looks up a message by Message-Id header, and returns the ID
of the message in storage. Used when opening a previously saved draft message
for editing again.
If no message is find, zero is returned, not an error.

Functions.Name: MessageCompose
Functions.Docs:
MessageCompose composes a message and saves it to the mailbox. Used for
saving draft messages.

Functions.Name: MessageSubmit
Functions.Docs:
MessageSubmit sends a message by submitting it the outgoing email queue. The
message is sent to all addresses listed in the To, Cc and Bcc addresses, without
Bcc message header.

If a Sent mailbox is configured, messages are added to it after submitting
to the delivery queue. If Bcc addresses were present, a header is prepended
to the message stored in the Sent mailbox.

Functions.Name: MessageMove
Functions.Docs:
MessageMove moves messages to another mailbox. If the message is already in
the mailbox an error is returned.

Functions.Name: MessageDelete
Functions.Docs: MessageDelete permanently deletes messages, without moving them to the Trash mailbox.

Functions.Name: FlagsAdd
Functions.Docs:
FlagsAdd adds flags, either system flags like \Seen or custom keywords. The
flags should be lower-case, but will be converted and verified.

Functions.Name: FlagsClear
Functions.Docs: FlagsClear clears flags, either system flags like \Seen or custom keywords.

Functions.Name: MailboxesMarkRead
Functions.Docs:
MailboxesMarkRead marks all messages in mailboxes as read. Child mailboxes are
not automatically included, they must explicitly be included in the list of IDs.

Functions.Name: MailboxCreate
Functions.Docs: MailboxCreate creates a new mailbox.

Functions.Name: MailboxDelete
Functions.Docs: MailboxDelete deletes a mailbox and all its messages and annotations.

Functions.Name: MailboxEmpty
Functions.Docs:
MailboxEmpty empties a mailbox, removing all messages from the mailbox, but not
its child mailboxes.

Functions.Name: MailboxRename
Functions.Docs:
MailboxRename renames a mailbox, possibly moving it to a new parent. The mailbox
ID and its messages are unchanged.

Functions.Name: CompleteRecipient
Functions.Docs:
CompleteRecipient returns autocomplete matches for a recipient, returning the
matches, most recently used first, and whether this is the full list and further
requests for longer prefixes aren't necessary.

Functions.Name: MailboxSetSpecialUse
Functions.Docs: MailboxSetSpecialUse sets the special use flags of a mailbox.

Functions.Name: ThreadCollapse
Functions.Docs:
ThreadCollapse saves the ThreadCollapse field for the messages and its
children. The messageIDs are typically thread roots. But not all roots
(without parent) of a thread need to have the same collapsed state.

Functions.Name: ThreadMute
Functions.Docs:
ThreadMute saves the ThreadMute field for the messages and their children.
If messages are muted, they are also marked collapsed.

Functions.Name: RecipientSecurity
Functions.Docs:
RecipientSecurity looks up security properties of the address in the
single-address message addressee (as it appears in a To/Cc/Bcc/etc header).

Functions.Name: DecodeMIMEWords
Functions.Docs: DecodeMIMEWords decodes Q/B-encoded words for a mime headers into UTF-8 text.

Functions.Name: SettingsSave
Functions.Docs: SettingsSave saves settings, e.g. for composing.

Functions.Name: SSETypes
Functions.Docs: SSETypes exists to ensure the generated API contains the types, for use in SSE events.

Structs.Name: Request
Structs.Docs:
Request is a request to an SSE connection to send messages, either for a new
view, to continue with an existing view, or to a cancel an ongoing request.

Fields.Name: SSEID
Fields.Docs: SSE connection.

Fields.Name: ViewID
Fields.Docs: To indicate a request is a continuation (more results) of the previous view. Echoed in events, client checks if it is getting results for the latest request.

Fields.Name: Cancel
Fields.Docs: If set, this request and its view are canceled. A new view must be started.

Structs.Name: Query
Structs.Docs: Query is a request for messages that match filters, in a given order.

Fields.Name: OrderAsc
Fields.Docs: Order by received ascending or desending.

Structs.Name: Filter
Structs.Docs:
Filter selects the messages to return. Fields that are set must all match,
for slices each element by match ("and").

Fields.Name: MailboxID
Fields.Docs: If -1, then all mailboxes except Trash/Junk/Rejects. Otherwise, only active if > 0.

Fields.Name: MailboxChildrenIncluded
Fields.Docs: If true, also submailboxes are included in the search.

Fields.Name: MailboxName
Fields.Docs: In case client doesn't know mailboxes and their IDs yet. Only used during sse connection setup, where it is turned into a MailboxID. Filtering only looks at MailboxID.

Fields.Name: Words
Fields.Docs: Case insensitive substring match for each string.

Fields.Name: To
Fields.Docs: Including Cc and Bcc.

Fields.Name: Headers
Fields.Docs: Header values can be empty, it's a check if the header is present, regardless of value.

Structs.Name: NotFilter
Structs.Docs: NotFilter matches messages that don't match these fields.

Structs.Name: Page
Structs.Docs: Page holds pagination parameters for a request.

Fields.Name: AnchorMessageID
Fields.Docs: Start returning messages after this ID, if > 0. For pagination, fetching the next set of messages.

Fields.Name: Count
Fields.Docs: Number of messages to return, must be >= 1, we never return more than 10000 for one request.

Fields.Name: DestMessageID
Fields.Docs: If > 0, return messages until DestMessageID is found. More than Count messages can be returned. For long-running searches, it may take a while before this message if found.

Structs.Name: ParsedMessage
Structs.Docs:
ParsedMessage has more parsed/derived information about a message, intended
for rendering the (contents of the) message. Information from MessageItem is
not duplicated.

Fields.Name: Texts
Fields.Docs: Contents of text parts, can be empty.

Fields.Name: HasHTML
Fields.Docs: Whether there is an HTML part. The webclient renders HTML message parts through an iframe and a separate request with strict CSP headers to prevent script execution and loading of external resources, which isn't possible when loading in iframe with inline HTML because not all browsers support the iframe csp attribute.

Fields.Name: ListReplyAddress
Fields.Docs: From List-Post.

Fields.Name: TextPaths
Fields.Docs: Paths to text parts.

Fields.Name: HTMLPath
Fields.Docs: Path to HTML part.

Structs.Name: Part
Structs.Docs:
Part represents a whole mail message, or a part of a multipart message. It
is designed to handle IMAP requirements efficiently.

Fields.Name: BoundaryOffset
Fields.Docs: Offset in message where bound starts. -1 for top-level message.

Fields.Name: HeaderOffset
Fields.Docs: Offset in message file where header starts.

Fields.Name: BodyOffset
Fields.Docs: Offset in message file where body starts.

Fields.Name: EndOffset
Fields.Docs: Where body of part ends. Set when part is fully read.

Fields.Name: RawLineCount
Fields.Docs: Number of lines in raw, undecoded, body of part. Set when part is fully read.

Fields.Name: DecodedSize
Fields.Docs: Number of octets when decoded. If this is a text mediatype, lines ending only in LF are changed end in CRLF and DecodedSize reflects that.

Fields.Name: MediaType
Fields.Docs: From Content-Type, upper case. E.g. "TEXT". Can be empty because content-type may be absent. In this case, the part may be treated as TEXT/PLAIN.

Fields.Name: MediaSubType
Fields.Docs: From Content-Type, upper case. E.g. "PLAIN".

Fields.Name: ContentTypeParams
Fields.Docs: E.g. holds "boundary" for multipart messages. Has lower-case keys, and original case values.

Fields.Name: ContentTransferEncoding
Fields.Docs: In upper case.

Fields.Name: Envelope
Fields.Docs: Email message headers. Not for non-message parts.

Fields.Name: Parts
Fields.Docs: Parts if this is a multipart.

Fields.Name: Message
Fields.Docs: Only for message/rfc822 and message/global. This part may have a buffer as backing io.ReaderAt, because a message/global can have a non-identity content-transfer-encoding. This part has a nil parent.

Structs.Name: Envelope
Structs.Docs: Envelope holds the basic/common message headers as used in IMAP4.

Fields.Name: Subject
Fields.Docs: Q/B-word-decoded.

Fields.Name: InReplyTo
Fields.Docs: From In-Reply-To header, includes <>.

Fields.Name: MessageID
Fields.Docs: From Message-Id header, includes <>.

Structs.Name: Address
Structs.Docs: Address as used in From and To headers.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Docs: Free-form name for display in mail applications.

Fields.Name: User
Fields.Docs: Localpart, encoded as string. Must be parsed before using as Localpart.

Fields.Name: Host
Fields.Docs: Domain in ASCII.

Structs.Name: MessageAddress
Structs.Docs:
MessageAddress is like message.Address, but with a dns.Domain, with unicode name
included.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Docs: Free-form name for display in mail applications.

Fields.Name: User
Fields.Docs: Localpart, encoded.

Structs.Name: Domain
Structs.Docs:
Domain is a domain name, with one or more labels, with at least an ASCII
representation, and for IDNA non-ASCII domains a unicode representation.
The ASCII string must be used for DNS lookups. The strings do not have a
trailing dot. When using with StrictResolver, add the trailing dot.

Fields.Name: ASCII
Fields.Docs: A non-unicode domain, e.g. with A-labels (xn--...) or NR-LDH (non-reserved letters/digits/hyphens) labels. Always in lower case. No trailing dot.

Fields.Name: Unicode
Fields.Docs: Name as U-labels, in Unicode NFC. Empty if this is an ASCII-only domain. No trailing dot.

Structs.Name: FromAddressSettings
Structs.Docs: FromAddressSettings are webmail client settings per "From" address.

Fields.Name: FromAddress
Fields.Docs: Unicode.

Structs.Name: ComposeMessage
Structs.Docs: ComposeMessage is a message to be composed, for saving draft messages.

Fields.Name: ReplyTo
Fields.Docs: If non-empty, Reply-To header to add to message.

Fields.Name: ResponseMessageID
Fields.Docs: If set, this was a reply or forward, based on IsForward.

Fields.Name: DraftMessageID
Fields.Docs: If set, previous draft message that will be removed after composing new message.

Structs.Name: SubmitMessage
Structs.Docs:
SubmitMessage is an email message to be sent to one or more recipients.
Addresses are formatted as just email address, or with a name like "name
<user@host>".

Fields.Name: ReplyTo
Fields.Docs: If non-empty, Reply-To header to add to message.

Fields.Name: ResponseMessageID
Fields.Docs: If set, this was a reply or forward, based on IsForward.

Fields.Name: UserAgent
Fields.Docs: User-Agent header added if not empty.

Fields.Name: RequireTLS
Fields.Docs: For "Require TLS" extension during delivery.

Fields.Name: FutureRelease
Fields.Docs: If set, time (in the future) when message should be delivered from queue.

Fields.Name: ArchiveThread
Fields.Docs: If set, thread is archived after sending message.

Fields.Name: ArchiveReferenceMailboxID
Fields.Docs: If ArchiveThread is set, thread messages from this mailbox ID are moved to the archive mailbox ID. E.g. of Inbox.

Fields.Name: DraftMessageID
Fields.Docs: If set, draft message that will be removed after sending.

Structs.Name: File
Structs.Docs:
File is a new attachment (not from an existing message that is being
forwarded) to send with a SubmitMessage.

Fields.Name: DataURI
Fields.Docs: Full data of the attachment, with base64 encoding and including content-type.

Structs.Name: ForwardAttachments
Structs.Docs: ForwardAttachments references attachments by a list of message.Part paths.

Fields.Name: MessageID
Fields.Docs: Only relevant if MessageID is not 0.

Fields.Name: Paths
Fields.Docs: List of attachments, each path is a list of indices into the top-level message.Part.Parts.

Structs.Name: Mailbox
Structs.Docs: Mailbox is collection of messages, e.g. Inbox or Sent.

Fields.Name: ModSeq
Fields.Docs: Of last change, or when deleted.

Fields.Name: ParentID
Fields.Docs: Zero for top-level mailbox.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Docs: "Inbox" is the name for the special IMAP "INBOX". Slash separated for hierarchy. Names must be unique for mailboxes that are not expunged.

Fields.Name: UIDValidity
Fields.Docs: If UIDs are invalidated, e.g. when renaming a mailbox to a previously existing name, UIDValidity must be changed. Used by IMAP for synchronization.

Fields.Name: UIDNext
Fields.Docs: UID likely to be assigned to next message. Used by IMAP to detect messages delivered to a mailbox.

Fields.Name: Draft
Fields.Docs: "Drafts"

Fields.Name: Keywords
Fields.Docs: Keywords as used in messages. Storing a non-system keyword for a message automatically adds it to this list. Used in the IMAP FLAGS response. Only "atoms" are allowed (IMAP syntax), keywords are case-insensitive, only stored in lower case (for JMAP), sorted.

Fields.Name: HaveCounts
Fields.Docs: Deprecated. Covered by Upgrade.MailboxCounts. No longer read.

Fields.Name: Total
Fields.Docs: Total number of messages, excluding \Deleted. For JMAP.

Fields.Name: Deleted
Fields.Docs: Number of messages with \Deleted flag. Used for IMAP message count that includes messages with \Deleted.

Fields.Name: Unread
Fields.Docs: Messages without \Seen, excluding those with \Deleted, for JMAP.

Fields.Name: Unseen
Fields.Docs: Messages without \Seen, including those with \Deleted, for IMAP.

Fields.Name: Size
Fields.Docs: Number of bytes for all messages.

Structs.Name: RecipientSecurity
Structs.Docs:
RecipientSecurity is a quick analysis of the security properties of delivery to
the recipient (domain).

Fields.Name: STARTTLS
Fields.Docs: Whether recipient domain supports (opportunistic) STARTTLS, as seen during most recent delivery attempt. Will be "unknown" if no delivery to the domain has been attempted yet.

Fields.Name: MTASTS
Fields.Docs: Whether we have a stored enforced MTA-STS policy, or domain has MTA-STS DNS record.

Fields.Name: DNSSEC
Fields.Docs: Whether MX lookup response was DNSSEC-signed.

Fields.Name: DANE
Fields.Docs: Whether first delivery destination has DANE records.

Fields.Name: RequireTLS
Fields.Docs: Whether recipient domain is known to implement the REQUIRETLS SMTP extension. Will be "unknown" if no delivery to the domain has been attempted yet.

Structs.Name: Settings
Structs.Docs: Settings are webmail client settings.

Fields.Name: ID
Fields.Docs: Singleton ID 1.

Fields.Name: ShowAddressSecurity
Fields.Docs: Whether to show the bars underneath the address input fields indicating starttls/dnssec/dane/mtasts/requiretls support by address.

Fields.Name: ShowHTML
Fields.Docs: Show HTML version of message by default, instead of plain text.

Fields.Name: NoShowShortcuts
Fields.Docs: If true, don't show shortcuts in webmail after mouse interaction.

Fields.Name: ShowHeaders
Fields.Docs: Additional headers to display in message view. E.g. Delivered-To, User-Agent, X-Mox-Reason.

Fields.Name: IsForward
Fields.Docs: todo: once we implement ARC, we can use dkim domains that we cannot verify but that the arc-verified forwarding mail server was able to verify.

Structs.Name: EventStart
Structs.Docs:
EventStart is the first message sent on an SSE connection, giving the client
basic data to populate its UI. After this event, messages will follow quickly in
an EventViewMsgs event.

Fields.Name: DomainAddressConfigs
Fields.Docs: ASCII domain to address config.

Fields.Name: AccountPath
Fields.Docs: If nonempty, the path on same host to webaccount interface.

Structs.Name: DomainAddressConfig
Structs.Docs:
DomainAddressConfig has the address (localpart) configuration for a domain, so
the webmail client can decide if an address matches the addresses of the
account.

Fields.Name: LocalpartCatchallSeparators
Fields.Docs: Can be empty.

Structs.Name: EventViewErr
Structs.Docs:
EventViewErr indicates an error during a query for messages. The request is
aborted, no more request-related messages will be sent until the next request.

Fields.Name: Err
Fields.Docs: To be displayed in client.

Structs.Name: EventViewReset
Structs.Docs:
EventViewReset indicates that a request for the next set of messages in a few
could not be fulfilled, e.g. because the anchor message does not exist anymore.
The client should clear its list of messages. This can happen before
EventViewMsgs events are sent.

Structs.Name: EventViewMsgs
Structs.Docs:
EventViewMsgs contains messages for a view, possibly a continuation of an
earlier list of messages.

Fields.Name: MessageItems
Fields.Docs: If empty, this was the last message for the request. If non-empty, a list of thread messages. Each with the first message being the reason this thread is included and can be used as AnchorID in followup requests. If the threading mode is "off" in the query, there will always be only a single message. If a thread is sent, all messages in the thread are sent, including those that don't match the query (e.g. from another mailbox). Threads can be displayed based on the ThreadParentIDs field, with possibly slightly different display based on field ThreadMissingLink.

Fields.Name: ParsedMessage
Fields.Docs: If set, will match the target page.DestMessageID from the request.

Fields.Name: ViewEnd
Fields.Docs: If set, there are no more messages in this view at this moment. Messages can be added, typically via Change messages, e.g. for new deliveries.

Structs.Name: MessageItem
Structs.Docs:
MessageItem is sent by queries, it has derived information analyzed from
message.Part, made for the needs of the message items in the message list.
messages.

Fields.Name: Message
Fields.Docs: Without ParsedBuf and MsgPrefix, for size. With Preview, even if it isn't stored yet in the database.

Fields.Name: MatchQuery
Fields.Docs: If message does not match query, it can still be included because of threading.

Fields.Name: MoreHeaders
Fields.Docs: All headers from store.Settings.ShowHeaders that are present.

Structs.Name: Message
Structs.Docs:
Message stored in database and per-message file on disk.

Contents are always the combined data from MsgPrefix and the on-disk file named
based on ID.

Messages always have a header section, even if empty. Incoming messages without
header section must get an empty header section added before inserting.

Fields.Name: ID
Fields.Docs: ID of the message, determines path to on-disk message file. Set when adding to a mailbox. When a message is moved to another mailbox, the mailbox ID is changed, but for synchronization purposes, a new Message record is inserted (which gets a new ID) with the Expunged field set and the MailboxID and UID copied.

Fields.Name: UID
Fields.Docs: UID, for IMAP. Set when adding to mailbox. Strictly increasing values, per mailbox. The UID of a message can never change (though messages can be copied), and the contents of a message/UID also never changes.

Fields.Name: ModSeq
Fields.Docs: Modification sequence, for faster syncing with IMAP QRESYNC and JMAP. ModSeq is the last modification. CreateSeq is the Seq the message was inserted, always <= ModSeq. If Expunged is set, the message has been removed and should not be returned to the user. In this case, ModSeq is the Seq where the message is removed, and will never be changed again. We have an index on both ModSeq (for JMAP that synchronizes per account) and MailboxID+ModSeq (for IMAP that synchronizes per mailbox). The index on CreateSeq helps efficiently finding created messages for JMAP. The value of ModSeq is special for IMAP. Messages that existed before ModSeq was added have 0 as value. But modseq 0 in IMAP is special, so we return it as 1. If we get modseq 1 from a client, the IMAP server will translate it to 0. When we return modseq to clients, we turn 0 into 1.

Fields.Name: IsReject
Fields.Docs: If set, this message was delivered to a Rejects mailbox. When it is moved to a different mailbox, its MailboxOrigID is set to the destination mailbox and this flag cleared.

Fields.Name: IsForward
Fields.Docs: If set, this is a forwarded message (through a ruleset with IsForward). This causes fields used during junk analysis to be moved to their Orig variants, and masked IP fields cleared, so they aren't used in junk classifications for incoming messages. This ensures the forwarded messages don't cause negative reputation for the forwarding mail server, which may also be sending regular messages.

Fields.Name: MailboxOrigID
Fields.Docs: MailboxOrigID is the mailbox the message was originally delivered to. Typically Inbox or Rejects, but can also be a mailbox configured in a Ruleset, or Postmaster, TLS/DMARC reporting addresses. MailboxOrigID is not changed when the message is moved to another mailbox, e.g. Archive/Trash/Junk. Used for per-mailbox reputation.  MailboxDestinedID is normally 0, but when a message is delivered to the Rejects mailbox, it is set to the intended mailbox according to delivery rules, typically that of Inbox. When such a message is moved out of Rejects, the MailboxOrigID is corrected by setting it to MailboxDestinedID. This ensures the message is used for reputation calculation for future deliveries to that mailbox.  These are not bstore references to prevent having to update all messages in a mailbox when the original mailbox is removed. Use of these fields requires checking if the mailbox still exists.

Fields.Name: Received
Fields.Docs: Received indicates time of receival over SMTP, or of IMAP APPEND.

Fields.Name: SaveDate
Fields.Docs: SaveDate is the time of copy/move/save to a mailbox, used with IMAP SAVEDATE extension. Must be updated each time a message is copied/moved to another mailbox. Can be nil for messages from before this functionality was introduced.

Fields.Name: RemoteIP
Fields.Docs: Full IP address of remote SMTP server. Empty if not delivered over SMTP. The masked IPs are used to classify incoming messages. They are left empty for messages matching a ruleset for forwarded messages.

Fields.Name: RemoteIPMasked1
Fields.Docs: For IPv4 /32, for IPv6 /64, for reputation.

Fields.Name: RemoteIPMasked2
Fields.Docs: For IPv4 /26, for IPv6 /48.

Fields.Name: RemoteIPMasked3
Fields.Docs: For IPv4 /21, for IPv6 /32.

Fields.Name: EHLODomain
Fields.Docs: Only set if present and not an IP address. Unicode string. Empty for forwarded messages.

Fields.Name: MailFrom
Fields.Docs: With localpart and domain. Can be empty.

Fields.Name: MailFromLocalpart
Fields.Docs: SMTP "MAIL FROM", can be empty.

Fields.Name: MailFromDomain
Fields.Docs: Only set if it is a domain, not an IP. Unicode string. Empty for forwarded messages, but see OrigMailFromDomain.

Fields.Name: RcptToLocalpart
Fields.Docs: SMTP "RCPT TO", can be empty.

Fields.Name: RcptToDomain
Fields.Docs: Unicode string.

Fields.Name: MsgFromLocalpart
Fields.Docs: Parsed "From" message header, used for reputation along with domain validation.

Fields.Name: MsgFromDomain
Fields.Docs: Unicode string.

Fields.Name: MsgFromOrgDomain
Fields.Docs: Unicode string.

Fields.Name: EHLOValidated
Fields.Docs: Simplified statements of the Validation fields below, used for incoming messages to check reputation.

Fields.Name: EHLOValidation
Fields.Docs: Validation can also take reverse IP lookup into account, not only SPF.

Fields.Name: MailFromValidation
Fields.Docs: Can have SPF-specific validations like ValidationSoftfail.

Fields.Name: MsgFromValidation
Fields.Docs: Desirable validations: Strict, DMARC, Relaxed. Will not be just Pass.

Fields.Name: DKIMDomains
Fields.Docs: Domains with verified DKIM signatures. Unicode string. For forwarded messages, a DKIM domain that matched a ruleset's verified domain is left out, but included in OrigDKIMDomains.

Fields.Name: OrigEHLODomain
Fields.Docs: For forwarded messages,

Fields.Name: MessageID
Fields.Docs: Canonicalized Message-Id, always lower-case and normalized quoting, without <>'s. Empty if missing. Used for matching message threads, and to prevent duplicate reject delivery.

Fields.Name: SubjectBase
Fields.Docs: For matching threads in case there is no References/In-Reply-To header. It is lower-cased, white-space collapsed, mailing list tags and re/fwd tags removed.

Fields.Name: MessageHash
Fields.Docs: Hash of message. For rejects delivery in case there is no Message-ID, only set when delivered as reject.

Fields.Name: ThreadID
Fields.Docs: ID of message starting this thread.

Fields.Name: ThreadParentIDs
Fields.Docs: IDs of parent messages, from closest parent to the root message. Parent messages may be in a different mailbox, or may no longer exist. ThreadParentIDs must never contain the message id itself (a cycle), and parent messages must reference the same ancestors. Moving a message to another mailbox keeps the message ID and changes the MailboxID (and UID) of the message, leaving threading parent ids intact.

Fields.Name: ThreadMissingLink
Fields.Docs: ThreadMissingLink is true if there is no match with a direct parent. E.g. first ID in ThreadParentIDs is not the direct ancestor (an intermediate message may have been deleted), or subject-based matching was done.

Fields.Name: ThreadMuted
Fields.Docs: If set, newly delivered child messages are automatically marked as read. This field is copied to new child messages. Changes are propagated to the webmail client.

Fields.Name: ThreadCollapsed
Fields.Docs: If set, this (sub)thread is collapsed in the webmail client, for threading mode "on" (mode "unread" ignores it). This field is copied to new child message. Changes are propagated to the webmail client.

Fields.Name: IsMailingList
Fields.Docs: If received message was known to match a mailing list rule (with modified junk filtering).

Fields.Name: DSN
Fields.Docs: If this message is a DSN, generated by us or received. For DSNs, we don't look at the subject when matching threads.

Fields.Name: ReceivedTLSVersion
Fields.Docs: 0 if unknown, 1 if plaintext/no TLS, otherwise TLS cipher suite.

Fields.Name: ReceivedRequireTLS
Fields.Docs: Whether RequireTLS was known to be used for incoming delivery.

Fields.Name: Keywords
Fields.Docs: For keywords other than system flags or the basic well-known $-flags. Only in "atom" syntax (IMAP), they are case-insensitive, always stored in lower-case (for JMAP), sorted.

Fields.Name: TrainedJunk
Fields.Docs: If nil, no training done yet. Otherwise, true is trained as junk, false trained as nonjunk.

Fields.Name: MsgPrefix
Fields.Docs: Typically holds received headers and/or header separator.

Fields.Name: Preview
Fields.Docs: If non-nil, a preview of the message based on text and/or html parts of the message. Used in the webmail and IMAP PREVIEW extension. If non-nil, it is empty if no preview could be created, or the message has not textual content or couldn't be parsed. Previews are typically created when delivering a message, but not when importing messages, for speed. Previews are generated on first request (in the webmail, or through the IMAP fetch attribute "PREVIEW" (without "LAZY")), and stored with the message at that time. The preview is at most 256 characters (can be more bytes), with detected quoted text replaced with "[...]". Previews typically end with a newline, callers may want to strip whitespace.

Fields.Name: ParsedBuf
Fields.Docs: ParsedBuf message structure. Currently saved as JSON of message.Part because bstore wasn't able to store recursive types when this was implemented. Created when first needed, and saved in the database. todo: once replaced with non-json storage, remove date fixup in ../message/part.go.

Structs.Name: MessageEnvelope
Structs.Docs:
MessageEnvelope is like message.Envelope, as used in message.Part, but including
unicode host names for IDNA names.

Fields.Name: Date
Fields.Docs: todo: should get sherpadoc to understand type embeds and embed the non-MessageAddress fields from message.Envelope.

Structs.Name: Attachment
Structs.Docs:
Attachment is a MIME part is an existing message that is not intended as
viewable text or HTML part.

Fields.Name: Path
Fields.Docs: Indices into top-level message.Part.Parts.

Fields.Name: Filename
Fields.Docs: File name based on "name" attribute of "Content-Type", or the "filename" attribute of "Content-Disposition".

Structs.Name: EventViewChanges
Structs.Docs:
EventViewChanges contain one or more changes relevant for the client, either
with new mailbox total/unseen message counts, or messages added/removed/modified
(flags) for the current view.

Fields.Name: Changes
Fields.Docs: The first field of [2]any is a string, the second of the Change types below.

Structs.Name: ChangeMsgAdd
Structs.Docs: ChangeMsgAdd adds a new message and possibly its thread to the view.

Fields.Name: Flags
Fields.Docs: System flags.

Fields.Name: Keywords
Fields.Docs: Other flags.

Fields.Name: MessageCountIMAP
Fields.Docs: For IMAP NOTIFY.

Structs.Name: Flags
Structs.Docs: Flags for a mail message.

Structs.Name: ChangeMsgRemove
Structs.Docs: ChangeMsgRemove removes one or more messages from the view.

Fields.Name: UIDs
Fields.Docs: Must be in increasing UID order, for IMAP.

Fields.Name: MsgIDs
Fields.Docs: Message.ID, for erasing, order does not necessarily correspond with UIDs!

Fields.Name: UIDNext
Fields.Docs: For IMAP NOTIFY.

Structs.Name: ChangeMsgFlags
Structs.Docs: ChangeMsgFlags updates flags for one message.

Fields.Name: Mask
Fields.Docs: Which flags are actually modified.

Fields.Name: Flags
Fields.Docs: New flag values. All are set, not just mask.

Fields.Name: Keywords
Fields.Docs: Non-system/well-known flags/keywords/labels.

Fields.Name: UIDValidity
Fields.Docs: For IMAP NOTIFY.

Structs.Name: ChangeMsgThread
Structs.Docs: ChangeMsgThread updates muted/collapsed fields for one message.

Structs.Name: ChangeMailboxRemove
Structs.Docs: ChangeMailboxRemove indicates a mailbox was removed, including all its messages.

Structs.Name: ChangeMailboxAdd
Structs.Docs: ChangeMailboxAdd indicates a new mailbox was added, initially without any messages.

Structs.Name: ChangeMailboxRename
Structs.Docs:
ChangeMailboxRename indicates a mailbox was renamed. Its ID stays the same.
It could be under a new parent.

Structs.Name: ChangeMailboxCounts
Structs.Docs: ChangeMailboxCounts set new total and unseen message counts for a mailbox.

Fields.Name: Total
Fields.Docs: Total number of messages, excluding \Deleted. For JMAP.

Fields.Name: Deleted
Fields.Docs: Number of messages with \Deleted flag. Used for IMAP message count that includes messages with \Deleted.

Fields.Name: Unread
Fields.Docs: Messages without \Seen, excluding those with \Deleted, for JMAP.

Fields.Name: Unseen
Fields.Docs: Messages without \Seen, including those with \Deleted, for IMAP.

Fields.Name: Size
Fields.Docs: Number of bytes for all messages.

Structs.Name: ChangeMailboxSpecialUse
Structs.Docs: ChangeMailboxSpecialUse has updated special-use flags for a mailbox.

Structs.Name: SpecialUse
Structs.Docs:
SpecialUse identifies a specific role for a mailbox, used by clients to
understand where messages should go.

Fields.Name: Draft
Fields.Docs: "Drafts"

Structs.Name: ChangeMailboxKeywords
Structs.Docs:
ChangeMailboxKeywords has an updated list of keywords for a mailbox, e.g. after
a message was added with a keyword that wasn't in the mailbox yet.

Ints.Name: ModSeq
Ints.Docs:
ModSeq represents a modseq as stored in the database. ModSeq 0 in the
database is sent to the client as 1, because modseq 0 is special in IMAP.
ModSeq coming from the client are of type int64.

Strings.Name: AttachmentType
Strings.Docs: AttachmentType is for filtering by attachment type.

Strings.Name: ViewMode
Strings.Docs:
ViewMode how a message should be viewed: its text parts, html parts, or html
with loading external resources.

Strings.Name: SecurityResult
Strings.Docs: SecurityResult indicates whether a security feature is supported.

Values.Name: SecurityResultUnknown
Values.Docs:
Unknown whether supported. Finding out may only be (reasonably) possible when
trying (e.g. SMTP STARTTLS). Once tried, the result may be cached for future
lookups.

Strings.Name: Quoting
Strings.Docs: Quoting is a setting for how to quote in replies/forwards.

Values.Name: Default
Values.Docs: Bottom-quote if text is selected, top-quote otherwise.

Strings.Name: Localpart
Strings.Docs:
Localpart is a decoded local part of an email address, before the "@".
For quoted strings, values do not hold the double quote or escaping backslashes.
An empty string can be a valid localpart.
Localparts are in Unicode NFC.
